sections.description: To start making the Tex-Mex shredded beef enchiladas, gather all your ingredients. You will need 2 pounds of chuck pot roast cut into small pieces, 2 to 3 chili chipotles in adobo sauce, 5 garlic cloves, 1 small onion, and 1 cup of crushed tomatoes. For the spices, prepare 2 tablespoons of chili powder, 1 tablespoon of ancho powder, oregano, salt to taste (about 2.5 tablespoons), 2 teaspoons of black pepper, 1 teaspoon of ground cumin, cocoa powder, and cinnamon. Finally, have 4 cups of water ready for the pressure cooking process.
supplies_needed: 2 to 3 chili chipotles in adobo sauce

sections.description: In a pressure cooker, add the prepared chuck pot roast along with the chili chipotles, garlic, onion, crushed tomatoes, and all the spices. Pour in the 4 cups of water, cover the pressure cooker, and set it to cook on high for 40 minutes. Once the cooking time is complete, carefully release the steam and open the lid. The aroma will be delightful! Remove the beef from the broth and strain the broth to separate it from any solids.

After removing the beef from the broth, let it cool slightly before shredding it. Use two forks or your hands to shred the meat into bite-sized pieces. Set the shredded beef aside as you prepare the sauce.

Return to the pressure cooker and switch to the saut√© setting. Skim off any excess oil from the top of the broth. Add half a cup of maseca to the broth and whisk it in until well combined. Gradually pour in the strained broth while whisking continuously to ensure the maseca dissolves completely. Allow the mixture to come to a simmer, which should take about 2 to 3 minutes, and taste for salt to adjust as needed. The sauce should thicken nicely.

In a pan over medium heat, add a little oil and lightly fry the tortillas for about 10 seconds on each side. This step helps to make the tortillas pliable for rolling. Repeat this process for all the tortillas you plan to use for the enchiladas.

To assemble the enchiladas, take a fried tortilla and add a portion of the shredded beef, some chopped onions, and a sprinkle of medium cheddar cheese. Roll the tortilla tightly and place it seam-side down on a plate. Repeat this process until all the tortillas are filled and rolled.

Once all the enchiladas are assembled, pour the prepared sauce over them generously. Top with additional medium cheddar cheese for extra flavor. Your enchiladas are now ready to be served and enjoyed!

Now for the best part, it's time to taste your delicious Tex-Mex shredded beef enchiladas! Serve them with a side of refried beans and rice if you like. Enjoy the perfect combination of flavors from the sauce and the meat. I hope you enjoy making and eating these enchiladas as much as I do!
